bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1827 Oct. 25
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from the Thursday October 25, 1827 session of court, during which a case involving the rights to a ferry was heard. The court decided that it cannot decide on this matter for it not have the authority to do so. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.head: October Term 1827
Thursday 25
div.p: Court met according tomorrow to adjournment Present

James P. Chisholm
and others vs
Alex. Alexander McCoy

As the Committee & Council have had the matter of controversy under their Consideration and never legally decided the rights of the landing contended for, we therefore are opinion that the rights of establishing, Roads, ferry's ferries & turnpikes is not visted vested in the Courts, but that the only authority must Come from the Committee & Council and therefore Cant establish the ferry to be rightfully possessed in either party_ and decide that each party pay their own Costs-
Court is adjourned untill until tomorrow 10 Oclock
